messageBody:
mandava71 wrote:

> Hi,
>
> I'm trying to understand how to use the TestSetup class as a
> decorator to do some setup for some test classes.
>
> If the setup is done in a subclass of TestSetup class and this wraps
> a TestCase subclass, how do the test methods in say, MyTestCase
> access the objects created in MyTestSetup.setUp() ? In the decorator
> pattern, there is no way for the component to access the contained
> object's data.

One property of a Decorator is that the wrappee cannot see what's in the
wrapper. This means that you cannot use TestSetup to do what you want
here. The TestCase needs to have all the fixture data, or the fixture
data has to be globally accessible. One-time test setup (like TestSetup)
always leads to global data.

For now, build a Registry (a Singleton that holds all the test data).

In the long term, change the tests or production code so you don't need
a shared test fixture.
